exercises.name: Kettlebell Swing (two-hand)
exercises.purpose: Hip power, posterior chain strength, conditioning transfer, back resilience.
setup: Stand with feet about shoulder width; KB a foot in front of you.
Hinge: push hips back, keep shins nearly vertical, spine neutral.
Grip the handle, tilt the bell toward you, pack shoulders (armpits tight).
steps: Hike-pass the bell back high between thighs (like snapping a football).
Snap hips forward hard; squeeze glutes; bell floats to chest height.
Arms stay relaxed like hooks; do not lift with shoulders.
Let the bell fall; hinge again; repeat. Breathing: sharp exhale at the top.
common_mistakes: Squatting instead of hinging (knees too far forward).
Overextending at the top (ribs flaring, leaning back).
Lifting with arms/shoulders instead of driving with hips.
Letting the bell drop low (keep it high in the hinge).
regressions: Swing with lighter bell (35–44 lb) and fewer reps.
progressions: Increase bell weight (53–70 lb) while keeping crisp form.
Increase density: EMOM (every minute on the minute) sets.
One-hand swings after Week 6 if shoulders feel great.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-Up (TGU)
exercises.purpose: Shoulder stability, core control, hip mobility, total-body coordination (excellent for duty durability).
setup: Lie on back; KB in right hand, arm vertical; right knee bent, left leg straight.
Left arm at ~45 degrees for support; eyes on the bell.
steps: Roll to left elbow (keep right arm locked).
Post to left hand; lift hips into a bridge (high hips).
Sweep left leg under to a lunge position (left knee under hip).
Windshield-wiper the back leg to square up; stand.
Reverse the steps back down with control. Switch sides.
common_mistakes: Bent elbow (keep the bell-side elbow locked).
Letting the knee collapse inward on the lunge.
regressions: Do it unloaded (shoe on fist) for 3 reps/side.
Use 35 lb and do partial get-ups (to elbow / to hand) first.
progressions: Increase weight gradually (44–62 lb).
Add pauses: 2 seconds at elbow/hand/bridge/lunge.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat (KB or DB)
exercises.purpose: Leg strength, hip mobility, posture under load.
setup: Hold KB horns at chest (or a DB vertically).
Feet shoulder width; toes slightly out; brace core.
steps: Sit down between hips; knees track over toes.
Keep chest tall; elbows inside knees at the bottom.
Drive up through midfoot; exhale near the top.
regressions: Box squat to a chair; reduce depth.
progressions: Heavier bell (53–70 lb).
Tempo squats: 3 seconds down, 1 second pause.

exercises.name: DB Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.purpose: Hamstrings/glutes/back strength; protects knees by strengthening hinge pattern.
setup: DBs in hands; stand tall; slight knee bend; ribs down.
steps: Hinge hips back; slide DBs down thighs; keep spine neutral.
Go to mid-shin or when hamstrings limit without rounding.
Drive hips forward; squeeze glutes at top.
common_mistakes: Turning into a squat (too much knee bend).
progressions: Heavier DBs, fewer reps (5–8).
Single-leg RDL (balance).

exercises.name: DB Floor Press
exercises.purpose: Press strength with shoulder-friendly range; builds push power for duty/combatives.
setup: Lie on floor; knees bent; DBs over chest; shoulder blades pulled down and back.
steps: Lower elbows to floor under control (45 degrees from body).
Pause lightly; press up to lockout; do not shrug.
progressions: Heavier DBs or pause reps.
Neutral grip for shoulder comfort.

exercises.name: DB Push Press
exercises.purpose: Explosive overhead power; transfers to lifting, striking strength, and gear handling.
setup: DBs at shoulders; feet hip width; brace core; glutes tight.
steps: Dip 2–4 inches (small knee bend).
Drive hard and press overhead; lockout with biceps near ears.
Lower with control back to shoulders.
progressions: Heavier DBs; reduce reps to 4–6.

exercises.name: 1-Arm DB Row
exercises.purpose: Pull strength for grappling, posture, and shoulder health; direct pull-up support.
setup: One hand on bench/chair; hinge; back flat; DB hangs under shoulder.
steps: Row DB to ribs/hip; elbow tight; pause 1 second.
Lower under control; keep torso still.
progressions: Heavier DB; 5–8 reps.
Chest-supported row if you add a bench.

exercises.name: Pull-up (strict) + Progressions
exercises.purpose: Climbing readiness, grip, upper-back strength, PFQ benefit, combatives control.
setup: Hands shoulder width; full hang; ribs down; glutes lightly tight.
steps: Pull elbows to ribs; chest toward bar; chin clears bar.
Lower to full hang under control (2–3 seconds).
common_mistakes: Kipping or swinging; half reps; craning neck.
Shrugging shoulders to ears (no shoulder pack).
regressions: Negatives: jump to top, lower 5–8 seconds.
progressions: Add weight with backpack once you can do 8+ clean reps.
EMOM density: 2–3 reps each minute for 10 minutes.

exercises.name: Farmer Carry / Suitcase Carry
exercises.purpose: Grip, trunk stiffness, posture under load, real-world strength (kids/gear).
setup: Pick up heavy DBs (or one DB for suitcase). Stand tall; ribs down; chin tucked.
steps: Walk slow and steady; shoulders down; avoid leaning.
Switch sides each set for suitcase carry.
progressions: Longer time 60–90 seconds; heavier weight.

exercises.name: Sandbag Bear-Hug Carry
exercises.purpose: Odd-object strength, grappling carryover, back and trunk durability.
setup: Hug bag high on chest; elbows down; brace; tall posture.
steps: Walk controlled; short steps; breathe behind the shield (slow exhales).
progressions: 60–80 lb; 40–60 sec sets; add slight hills.

exercises.name: Plank / Side Plank / Dead Bug
exercises.purpose: Core stiffness without spinal wear; protects back; transfers to fighting and rucking.
setup: Plank: elbows under shoulders; ribs down; glutes tight.
Side plank: elbow under shoulder; hips stacked.
steps: Hold steady; breathe; avoid sagging.
Dead bug: low back pressed into floor; move opposite arm/leg slowly.
common_mistakes: Hips sagging; holding breath; fast dead bug reps.
progressions: Longer holds; add suitcase carry core work.

exercises.name: Rucking (20 lb)
exercises.purpose: Aerobic base, leg/tendon durability, kit tolerance, fat loss with low joint impact.
setup: Pack weight high and tight; shoulder straps snug; waist belt if available.
Foot care: tape hotspots early; wool socks; dry feet post-ruck.
steps: Walk at conversational pace (Zone 2).
Posture: tall; ribs down; short stride; arms swing naturally.
common_mistakes: Too much weight too soon; trying to jog with a ruck.
progressions: Add time first; then consider 25–30 lb after Week 4 if joints feel good.

exercises.name: Norwegian 4x4 (VO2max Intervals)
exercises.purpose: Raise VO2 max and improve high-end aerobic power with sustained, repeatable hard efforts.
setup: Peloton bike preferred (lower impact than running while you’re rebuilding).
If you have a heart-rate strap, pair it (optional). Otherwise use RPE and output consistency.
Pick a ride type where you can control intensity: ‘Just Ride/Scenic’, a Power Zone ride, or any class where you can ignore callouts and ride your targets.
steps: Warm-up: 10 minutes easy (Zone 1–2). Include 2–3 x 20s smooth pickups with 40s easy to wake the legs.
Work x4: 4 minutes hard in Power Zone 5 (VO2) OR RPE 8–9 (you can say 1–3 words).
Recover between reps: 3 minutes very easy (Zone 1–2 spin). Let breathing settle.
Cool-down: 5–10 minutes easy + quick calves/hips mobility.
common_mistakes: Starting rep 1 like a sprint (you’ll fade badly by rep 3–4).
Making recoveries too hard (they should feel almost ‘too easy’).
Chasing a peak output instead of a repeatable output. Aim for steadiness across all 4 reps (within ~5%).
regressions: If knees/feet are cranky, keep it on the bike until tolerance improves.
progressions: After 2–3 weeks of full 4x4, add a small amount of output (or slightly increase resistance) while keeping cadence smooth.
Optional: add 10–15 minutes Zone 2 after the intervals if time allows (not required).
If you know your FTP (Power Zone test): target ~105–120% FTP for the work reps, but prioritize repeatability.
